name: Taurine (Longevity Dose)
description: Semi-essential amino acid that declines dramatically with age. A landmark 2023 Science paper showed taurine supplementation extended lifespan in mice by 10-12% and improved healthspan across multiple systems. Higher "longevity doses" (1-6g) differ from typical supplement amounts.

dosage.notes: Science 2023 paper used ~500-1000mg/kg in mice (human equivalent ~3-6g). Levels decline 80% with age. Take with meals. Very affordable.

keyFindings: Extended median lifespan by 10-12% in mice (Singh et al., Science 2023)
Blood taurine levels decline 80%+ from youth to old age
Improved bone density, muscle endurance, immune function, and metabolic health in aged mice
sideEffects: GI discomfort at very high doses
